item.title: Customer Journey: from potential to actual customers
item.description:
Customer Journey: from potential to actual customers

A customer journey usually consists of 3-6 phases

From obscurity to repeated buying. That’s what Customer Journey is. In between you’ll find different phases, and also different information needs per phase. A person just having realized he needs something goes online and looks for providers. Once found, he digs deeper and looks for product specifications so that he can compare the options. After having chosen and bought, he’ll look for further instructions.

item.title: Buyer persona describes your ideal customer
item.description:
Buyer persona describes your ideal customer

Record the basics

Buyer persona creates focus. You do not want to market and sell to the whole world, because that is a waste of your time. Instead, you want to know what exactly is your ideal customer group – the ones that are the most receptive to your products and services right now. Those people are described with Buyer Personas.

item.title: Inbound marketing educates and informs your customers
item.description:
Inbound marketing educates and informs your customers

A short history of inbound marketing

Inbound marketing is about publishing useful content for free for your current and potential customers. The daily and weekly routines of inbound marketing consist of regular content production such as blogging and video publishing, sharing the content in social media, engaging your readers by commenting and building links from other sites to your site. The objective is not to sell in the traditional sense, but to publish content that serves your customers in each of the phases of their customer journey. This will eventually result in some of them buying from you.
